channel.title: Help with exporting projects [Resolved...with magic apparently]
channel.description:
Ok, so I'm trynna export a track's individual instruments so I can pull them up in GarageBand and better edit/ mix them n stuff. But for some reason, when I try and open the ZIP file on my computer, i get an error saying the "original file was not found" something like that.
Idk what's wrong with it. Can anyone help me out?

item.title: Help with exporting projects [Resolved...with magic apparently]
item.dc:creator: Shivam
item.source: Help with exporting projects [Resolved...with magic apparently]

item.title: Help with exporting projects [Resolved...with magic apparently]

_(ツ)_/¯

Well I’m mainly looking to edit the individual instruments so I pretty much have to do it the Long way anyway

Thanks for the tip tho. Might help with mastering full projects n stuff

item.source: Help with exporting projects [Resolved...with magic apparently]

item.title: Help with exporting projects [Resolved...with magic apparently]
item.dc:creator: MisterMaster
item.description:
Hmmm…

El1011:

i cant actually hear anything while recording (no audio through headphones for some reason, even though they’re on the selected audio output)

Works for me via headphones.

El1011:

i cant play each individual instrument and record them. it just takes in all the audio, so if i wanted to just do drums for example, i couldn’t unless i muted every instrument for each bar

Yep.

El1011:

also it records at max volume, so there is some clipping issues whereas if i export & import all the sounds, there is no issue

Pretty sure you can change the input level.

Read full topic
item.source: Help with exporting projects [Resolved...with magic apparently]

item.title: Help with exporting projects [Resolved...with magic apparently]
item.dc:creator: El1011
item.description:
no not really

yes it would be easier to actually record audio but there’s more problems than benefits.

  1. i cant actually hear anything while recording (no audio through headphones for some reason, even though they’re on the selected audio output)
  2. i cant play each individual instrument and record them. it just takes in all the audio, so if i wanted to just do drums for example, i couldn’t unless i muted every instrument for each bar
  3. also it records at max volume, so there is some clipping issues whereas if i export & import all the sounds, there is no issue

Read full topic
item.source: Help with exporting projects [Resolved...with magic apparently]

item.title: Help with exporting projects [Resolved...with magic apparently]
item.dc:creator: MisterMaster
item.description:
Would it be easier to connect the iphone to the mac via USB (eg: using the standard apple USB cord), then play the track/ instrument(s) you want to capture as audio in Garage band?

Like this:

The Mac Observer – 5 Oct 17

How to Use Your iPhone as an Audio Input on Your Mac - The Mac Observer

Your iPhone can serve as an audio input source for your Mac, which is handy if you need to play or record something on your computer.

Read full topic
